intro: Siparuna olivaceovelutina, commonly known as the velvet olive, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It produces small, yellowish fruits that contain several seeds. Siparuna olivaceovelutina is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
